page.title: 07 The Keith Agricultural Show
page.content: One of the main annual events in Keith is the Keith Show.It is held on two days in August in Seafield Park.On the first day,there are displays of vintage tractors,steam engines and even an old threshing mill.On the second day, farmers from a wide area bring their prize animals to be shown.There are classes for cattle,sheep,pigs,goats, horses and donkeys.Also, poultry, pigeons,rabbits and guinea pigs are displayed in cages.Many large businesses have trade stands where farm goods and machinery are sold.Also present are local traders and the main Scottish banks.In the showground there is a tent for flowers and garden produce.The local public houses supply refreshments to thirsty people.There are hot-dog stands and ice-cream vans. In Reidhaven Square there is also a fairground which provides entertainment
